alert.note: Alert for South Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 22 at 8:47AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT TODAY THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible on recent wildfire burn scars. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central New Mexico, including the following areas, in central New Mexico, South Central Mountains. In north central New Mexico, East Slopes Sangre de Cristo Mountains and Southern Sangre de Cristo Mountains. This includes the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon and the McBride wildfire burn scar areas. * WHEN...From Noon MDT today through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Debris flows consisting of torrents of water, mud, ash, vegetation and timber will be possible downstream of burn scars. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Strong thunderstorms capable of heavy downpours are expected to develop this afternoon over the Sangre de Cristo and the Sacramento mountains of New Mexico. Within these areas, the sensitive Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon and McBride wildfire burn scars will be especially susceptible to heavy rainfall, abrupt runoff, flash flooding and the potential for debris flows today. - http://www.weather.gov/abq/EmergencyPrepFlood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
